title: The Bachelorette is rocked by a tanning injection discovery
text:
The Bachelorette producers were reportedly surprised to discover tanning injections in one of the contestants' rooms.

According to Woman's Day, crew members found vials of melanin, a synthetic hormone that is injected via a needle into the skin to give the user a deeper tan.

The drug is legal in Australia and Daily Mail is not suggesting that the owner of the melanin vials was doing anything unlawful.

Claims: The Bachelorette mansion has been rocked by a tanning injection discovery after producers 'found vials of skin-darkening melanin in one of the contestants' rooms'. Pictured: The Bachelorette cast with Angie Kent

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Channel 10 for comment.

Perhaps the most famous user of melanin-boosting injections is Martina Big, a white glamour model from Germany who darkened her skin to a 'crispy brown' complexion and now identifies as black.

'I am really proud that this medicine works well,' she told a British TV show last year. 'I can feel in myself that I am changing to a black woman.'

The drug is legal in Australia and it's not being suggested that the owner of the melanin vials was doing anything unlawful. Pictured: Angie Kent

In addition to changing the colour of her skin with melanin injections and a powerful 50-tube sunbed, Martina has also undergone extensive plastic surgery.

She boasts 32S breasts, which she describes as 'Europe's biggest', and has expressed interest in getting butt implants.

Martina first began dabbling with surgery in 2012, when her boyfriend encouraged her to take up modelling.

Bizarre: Perhaps the most famous user of melanin-boosting injections is Martina Big, a white glamour model from Germany who darkened her skin to a 'crispy brown' complexion and now identifies as black

Oddball: In addition to changing the colour of her skin with melanin injections and a powerful 50-tube sunbed, Martina has also undergone extensive plastic surgery. Pictured with her partner, Michael, in London on April 13, 2017

Meanwhile, The Bachelorette has reached its half-way point with nine contestants remaining in the race to win Angie Kent's heart.

Photos obtained by Daily Mail Australia last week have already confirmed the show's final four: Timm Hanly, Jackson Garlick, Ryan Anderson and Carlin Sterritt.

The Bachelorette continues Wednesday at 7:30pm on Channel 10
description: The Bachelorette producers were reportedly surprised to discover tanning injections in one of the contestants' rooms.
authors: Jo Scrimshire For Daily Mail Australia
